alert.note: Alert for McKenzie (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:50PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL MCKENZIE COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM CDT... At 450 PM CDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 6 miles northwest of Mandaree, or 21 miles east of Watford City, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central McKenzie County, including the following locations... Keene. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
